entry.content:
The Situational Awareness System (SAS) is a microservices-based platform designed to detect, analyze, and visualize real-world events in real time using social media data. This blog introduces the goals of the SAS project and highlights the architecture and technologies used.

Why SAS?​

Social media has become a primary source of real-time information. Our system leverages this by continuously scraping and analyzing data from platforms like Telegram and Twitter to identify events as they unfold.

Architecture Overview​

SAS follows a modular microservices architecture. Each service is responsible for a specific task, such as:

  • Scraping social media content
  • Detecting events using deep learning
  • Inferring location data
  • Managing user subscriptions and interests
  • Exposing data through a unified gateway

What's Next?​

In upcoming blog posts, we will dive deeper into each component of the SAS system, show how we implemented machine learning for event detection, and discuss the CI/CD process for deploying the platform.

Stay tuned!
